result.execSummary:
The defendant Loyal D Stowers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Loyal D Stowers in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 month in jail, with Huber for work release.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Jail start 9/4/15 7:00 pm.  Defendant may transfer to Sauk County  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  1 day of jail credit.
